summary.para: Displays a message window, also known as a dialog box, based on , which presents a message to the user. It is a modal window, blocking other actions in the application until the user closes it. A can contain text, buttons, and symbols that inform and instruct the user.
The difference to is that the message window displays in the center of the specified owner object.

member.summary: Specifies that the mouse pointer moves once to a new dialog box.

member.name: F:SilDev.Forms.MessageBoxEx.TopMost
member.summary: Specifies that the dialog box is placed above all non-topmost windows. This option has no effect if an owner is defined.

member.name: M:SilDev.Ini.Write``1(System.String,System.String,``0,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)

summary.para: Copies the specified value into the specified section of an INI file.
This function updates only the cache and has no effect on the file until is called.

member.param: The name of the section to which the value will be copied.

param.name: key
param.para: The name of the key to be associated with a value.
If this parameter is NULL, the entire section, including all entries within the section, is deleted.

param.name: value
param.para: The value to be written to the file.
If this parameter is NULL, the key pointed to by the key parameter is deleted.

member.param: The full file path or content of an INI file.
true to enable overwriting of a key with the same value as specified; otherwise, false.
true to skip an existing value, even it is not the same value as specified; otherwise, false.
The value index used to handle multiple key value pairs.

member.name: M:SilDev.Ini.WriteDirect(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Copies the representation of the specified value into the specified section of an INI file. If the file does not exist, it is created.
The Win32-API is used for writing in this case. Please note that this function writes the changes directly on the disk. This causes a lot of write accesses if it is used incorrectly.

member.param: The name of the section to which the value will be copied.

param.name: key
param.para: The name of the key to be associated with a value.
If this parameter is NULL, the entire section, including all entries within the section, is deleted.

param.name: value
param.para: The value to be written to the file.
If this parameter is NULL, the key pointed to by the key parameter is deleted.

member.param: The full path of an INI file.
true to enable overwriting of a key with the same value as specified; otherwise, false.
true to skip an existing value, even it is not the same value as specified; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets the name for the current log file.

summary.para: Gets or sets the location of the current log file.
If the specified path doesn't exist, it is created.
If the specified path is invalid or this process doesn't have the necessary permissions to write to this location, the location is changed to the Windows specified folder for temporary files.

member.name: P:SilDev.Log.FilePath
member.summary: Gets the full path of the current log file.

summary.para: Specifies the for the handling of 's. The can also specified over an command line argument or an config parameter in combination with . The following options are available.

0: Logging is disabled. If is enabled, unhandled 's are discarded. This can be useful for public releases to prevent any kind of notifications to the client. Please note that this functions may have dangerous consequences if it is used incorrectly.
1: Logging is enabled and all 's are logged.

2: Logging is enabled, all 's are logged, and a new window is allocated for the current process to display the current log in real time. Please note that the console is first allocated after the first logging.

member.name: M:SilDev.Log.AllowLogging(System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.param: The full path of the configuration file.

The key of the configuration file which hold the value, to specify the current .

member.name: T:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress
member.summary: Provides static methods to manage a progress bar hosted in a taskbar button.

member.name: T:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags
member.summary: Provides enumerated options that control the current state of the progres button.

member.name: F:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags.NoProgress
member.summary: Stops displaying progress and returns the button to its normal state. Call this method with this flag to dismiss the progress bar when the operation is complete or canceled.

member.name: F:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags.Indeterminate
member.summary: The progress indicator does not grow in size, but cycles repeatedly along the length of the taskbar button. This indicates activity without specifying what proportion of the progress is complete. Progress is taking place, but there is no prediction as to how long the operation will take.

member.name: F:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags.Normal
member.summary: The progress indicator grows in size from left to right in proportion to the estimated amount of the operation completed. This is a determinate progress indicator; a prediction is being made as to the duration of the operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags.Error
member.summary: The progress indicator turns red to show that an error has occurred in one of the windows that is broadcasting progress. This is a determinate state. If the progress indicator is in the indeterminate state, it switches to a red determinate display of a generic percentage not indicative of actual progress.

member.name: F:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags.Paused
member.summary: The progress indicator turns yellow to show that progress is currently stopped in one of the windows but can be resumed by the user. No error condition exists and nothing is preventing the progress from continuing. This is a determinate state. If the progress indicator is in the indeterminate state, it switches to a yellow determinate display of a generic percentage not indicative of actual progress.

member.name: M:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.SetState(System.IntPtr,SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.Flags)
member.summary: Sets the type and state of the progress indicator displayed on a taskbar button.
member.param: The handle of the window in which the progress of an operation is being shown.
The flag that control the current state of the progress button.

member.name: M:SilDev.TaskBar.Progress.SetValue(System.IntPtr,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Displays or updates a progress bar hosted in a taskbar button to show the specific percentage completed of the full operation.
member.param: The handle of the window whose associated taskbar button is being used as a progress indicator.
An application-defined value that indicates the proportion of the operation that has been completed at the time the method is called.
An application-defined value that specifies the value ullCompleted will have when the operation is complete.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.EnumChildProc

member.param: A handle to a child window of the parent window.
The application-defined value.
member.returns: To continue enumeration, the callback function must return TRUE; to stop enumeration, it must return FALSE.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.HookProc
member.summary: Represents a pointer to the hook procedure.
member.param: The hook code passed to the current hook procedure. The next hook procedure uses this code to determine how to process the hook information.
The wParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
The lParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of memory allocation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_COMMIT
member.summary: Allocates memory charges (from the overall size of memory and the paging files on disk) for the specified reserved memory pages. The function also guarantees that when the caller later initially accesses the memory, the contents will be zero. Actual physical pages are not allocated unless/until the virtual addresses are actually accessed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_RESERVE
member.summary: Reserves a range of the process's virtual address space without allocating any actual physical storage in memory or in the paging file on disk.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_DECOMMIT
member.summary: Decommits the specified region of committed pages. After the operation, the pages are in the reserved state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_RELEASE
member.summary: Releases the specified region of pages. After the operation, the pages are in the free state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_RESET
member.summary: Indicates that data in the memory range specified by lpAddress and dwSize is no longer of interest. The pages should not be read from or written to the paging file. However, the memory block will be used again later, so it should not be decommitted. This value cannot be used with any other value.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_PHYSICAL
member.summary: Reserves an address range that can be used to map Address Windowing Extensions (AWE) pages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_TOP_DOWN
member.summary: Allocates memory at the highest possible address. This can be slower than regular allocations, especially when there are many allocations.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_WRITE_WATCH
member.summary: Causes the system to track pages that are written to in the allocated region. If you specify this value, you must also specify .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AllocationTypes.MEM_LARGE_PAGES
member.summary: Allocates memory using large page support.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window animations.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates the window. Do not use this value with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_BLEND
member.summary: Uses a fade effect. This flag can be used only if hwnd is a top-level window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_CENTER
member.summary: Makes the window appear to collapse inward if is used or expand outward if the is not used. The various direction flags have no effect.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window. By default, the window is shown.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_HOR_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from left to right. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_HOR_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from right to left. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_SLIDE
member.summary: Uses slide animation. By default, roll animation is used. This flag is ignored when used with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_VER_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from top to bottom. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AnimateWindowFlags.AW_VER_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from bottom to top. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of appbar messages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_NEW
member.summary: Registers a new appbar and specifies the message identifier that the system should use to send notification messages to the appbar

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_REMOVE
member.summary: Unregisters an appbar, removing the bar from the system's internal list.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_QUERYPOS
member.summary: Requests a size and screen position for an appbar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_SETPOS
member.summary: Sets the size and screen position of an appbar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_GETSTATE
member.summary: Retrieves the autohide and always-on-top states of the Windows taskbar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_GETTASKBARPOS
member.summary: Retrieves the bounding rectangle of the Windows taskbar. Note that this applies only to the system taskbar. Other objects, particularly toolbars supplied with third-party software, also can be present. As a result, some of the screen area not covered by the Windows taskbar might not be visible to the user. To retrieve the area of the screen not covered by both the taskbar and other app barsthe working area available to your application, use the GetMonitorInfo function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Notifies the system to activate or deactivate an appbar. The lParam member of the pointed to by pData is set to TRUE to activate or FALSE to deactivate.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_GETAUTOHIDEBAR
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to the autohide appbar associated with a particular edge of the screen.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_SETAUTOHIDEBAR
member.summary: Registers or unregisters an autohide appbar for an edge of the screen.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: Notifies the system when an appbar's position has changed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_SETSTATE
member.summary: Sets the state of the appbar's autohide and always-on-top attributes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_GETAUTOHIDEBAREX
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to the autohide appbar associated with a particular edge of a particular monitor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AppBarMessageFunc.ABM_SETAUTOHIDEBAREX
member.summary: Registers or unregisters an autohide appbar for an edge of a particular monitor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.DuplicateFuncOptions.DUPLICATE_SAME_ACCESS

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemFreeTypes.MEM_DECOMMIT
member.summary: Decommits the specified region of committed pages. After the operation, the pages are in the reserved state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemFreeTypes.MEM_RELEASE

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of menu items.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_BYCOMMAND
member.summary: Indicates that the uPosition parameter gives the identifier of the menu item. The flag is the default if neither the nor flag is specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_BYPOSITION
member.summary: Indicates that the uPosition parameter gives the zero-based relative position of the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_BITMAP
member.summary: Uses a bitmap as the menu item. The lpNewItem parameter contains a handle to the bitmap.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_CHECKED
member.summary: Places a check mark next to the item. If your application provides check-mark bitmaps (see the SetMenuItemBitmaps function), this flag displays a selected bitmap next to the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables the menu item so that it cannot be selected, but this flag does not gray it.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_ENABLED
member.summary: Enables the menu item so that it can be selected and restores it from its grayed state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_GRAYED
member.summary: Disables the menu item and grays it so that it cannot be selected.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_MENUBARBREAK
member.summary: Functions the same as the MF_MENUBREAK flag for a menu bar. For a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu, the new column is separated from the old column by a vertical line.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_MENUBREAK
member.summary: Places the item on a new line (for menu bars) or in a new column (for a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu) without separating columns.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: Specifies that the item is an owner-drawn item. Before the menu is displayed for the first time, the window that owns the menu receives a WM_MEASUREITEM message to retrieve the width and height of the menu item. The WM_DRAWITEM message is then sent to the window procedure of the owner window whenever the appearance of the menu item must be updated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_POPUP
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item opens a drop-down menu or submenu. The uIDNewItem parameter specifies a handle to the drop-down menu or submenu. This flag is used to add a menu name to a menu bar or a menu item that opens a submenu to a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_SEPARATOR
member.summary: Draws a horizontal dividing line. This flag is used only in a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu. The line cannot be grayed, disabled, or highlighted. The lpNewItem and uIDNewItem parameters are ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_STRING
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item is a text string; the lpNewItem parameter is a pointer to the string.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_UNCHECKED
member.summary: Does not place a check mark next to the item (the default). If your application supplies check-mark bitmaps (see the SetMenuItemBitmaps function), this flag displays a clear bitmap next to the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFunc.MF_REMOVE
member.summary: Remove uPosition parameters.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the process information class.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc.ProcessBasicInformation
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to a PEB structure that can be used to determine whether the specified process is being debugged, and a unique value used by the system to identify the specified process.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc.ProcessDebugPort
member.summary: Retrieves a DWORD_PTR value that is the port number of the debugger for the process. A nonzero value indicates that the process is being run under the control of a ring 3 debugger.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc.ProcessWow64Information
member.summary: Determines whether the process is running in the WOW64 environment (WOW64 is the x86 emulator that allows Win32-based applications to run on 64-bit Windows).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc.ProcessImageFileName
member.summary: Retrieves a value containing the name of the image file for the process.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFunc.ProcessBreakOnTermination
member.summary: Retrieves a value indicating whether the process is considered critical.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of service errors.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.SERVICE_ERROR_CRITICAL
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.SERVICE_ERROR_IGNORE
member.summary: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.SERVICE_ERROR_NORMAL
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.SERVICE_ERROR_SEVERE
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated attributes of memory allocation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the flag.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING (0x0046) message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFunc.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window's show statements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFunc.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights
member.summary:
Provides enumerated values of standard access rights.
Each type of securable object has a set of access rights that correspond to operations specific to that type of object. In addition to these object-specific access rights, there is a set of standard access rights that correspond to operations common to most types of securable objects.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.DELETE
member.summary: The right to delete the object.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.READ_CONTROL
member.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.SYNCHRONIZE
member.summary: The right to use the object for synchronization. This enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state. Some object types do not support this access right.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.WRITE_DAC
member.summary: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.WRITE_OWNER
member.summary: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.STANDARD_RIGHTS_ALL
member.summary: Combines DELETE, READ_CONTROL, WRITE_DAC, and WRITE_OWNER access.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.STANDARD_RIGHTS_EXECUTE
member.summary: Currently defined to equal READ_CONTROL.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.STANDARD_RIGHTS_READ
member.summary: Currently defined to equal READ_CONTROL.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.STANDARD_RIGHTS_REQUIRED
member.summary: Combines DELETE, READ_CONTROL, WRITE_DAC, and WRITE_OWNER access.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE
member.summary: Currently defined to equal READ_CONTROL.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect
member.summary: Provides enumerated constants of memory protection.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_EXECUTE
member.summary: Enables execute access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_EXECUTE_READ
member.summary: Enables execute or read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or read/write access to the committed region of pages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as , and the change is written to the new page.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_NOACCESS
member.summary: Disables all access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to read from, write to, or execute the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_READONLY
member.summary: Enables read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, an attempt to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_READWRITE
member.summary: Enables read-only or read/write access to the committed region of pages. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_WRITECOPY
member.summary: Enables read-only or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as , and the change is written to the new page. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_TARGETS_INVALID
member.summary: Sets all locations in the pages as invalid targets for CFG. Used along with any execute page protection like , , and . Any indirect call to locations in those pages will fail CFG checks and the process will be terminated. The default behavior for executable pages allocated is to be marked valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_TARGETS_NO_UPDATE
member.summary: Pages in the region will not have their CFG information updated while the protection changes for VirtualProtect. For example, if the pages in the region was allocated using , then the invalid information will be maintained while the page protection changes. This flag is only valid when the protection changes to an executable type like , , and . The default behavior for VirtualProtect protection change to executable is to mark all locations as valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_GUARD
member.summary: Pages in the region become guard pages. Any attempt to access a guard page causes the system to raise a STATUS_GUARD_PAGE_VIOLATION (0x80000001) exception and turn off the guard page status. Guard pages thus act as a one-time access alarm.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_NOCACHE
member.summary: Sets all pages to be non-cachable. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped with can result in an .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.VirtualAllocFuncMemProtect.PAGE_WRITECOMBINE
member.summary: Sets all pages to be write-combined.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated hook constants.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_ACTIVATE
member.summary: The system is about to activate a window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_CLICKSKIPPED
member.summary: The system has removed a mouse message from the system message queue. Upon receiving this hook code, a CBT application must install a WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook procedure in response to the mouse message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_CREATEWND
member.summary: A window is about to be created. The system calls the hook procedure before sending the WM_CREATE or WM_NCCREATE message to the window. If the hook procedure returns a nonzero value, the system destroys the window; the CreateWindow function returns NULL, but the WM_DESTROY message is not sent to the window. If the hook procedure returns zero, the window is created normally. At the time of the HCBT_CREATEWND notification, the window has been created, but its final size and position may not have been determined and its parent window may not have been established. It is possible to send messages to the newly created window, although it has not yet received WM_NCCREATE or WM_CREATE messages. It is also possible to change the position in the z-order of the newly created window by modifying the hwndInsertAfter member of the CBT_CREATEWND structure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_DESTROYWND
member.summary: A window is about to be destroyed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_KEYSKIPPED
member.summary: The system has removed a keyboard message from the system message queue. Upon receiving this hook code, a CBT application must install a WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook procedure in response to the keyboard message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_MINMAX
member.summary: A window is about to be minimized or maximized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_MOVESIZE
member.summary: A window is about to be moved or sized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_QS
member.summary: The system has retrieved a WM_QUEUESYNC message from the system message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_SETFOCUS
member.summary: A window is about to receive the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.HCBT_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A system command is about to be carried out. This allows a CBT application to prevent task switching by means of hot keys.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.MSGF_DIALOGBOX
member.summary: The input event occurred in a message box or dialog box.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.MSGF_MENU
member.summary: The input event occurred in a menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.MSGF_SCROLLBAR
member.summary: The input event occurred in a scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_CALLWNDPROC
member.summary: The WH_CALLWNDPROC and WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hooks enable you to monitor messages sent to window procedures. The system calls a WH_CALLWNDPROC hook procedure before passing the message to the receiving window procedure, and calls the WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hook procedure after the window procedure has processed the message. The WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hook passes a pointer to a CWPRETSTRUCT structure to the hook procedure. The structure contains the return value from the window procedure that processed the message, as well as the message parameters associated with the message. Subclassing the window does not work for messages set between processes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_CALLWNDPROCRET
member.summary: The WH_CALLWNDPROC and WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hooks enable you to monitor messages sent to window procedures. The system calls a WH_CALLWNDPROC hook procedure before passing the message to the receiving window procedure, and calls the WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hook procedure after the window procedure has processed the message. The WH_CALLWNDPROCRET hook passes a pointer to a CWPRETSTRUCT structure to the hook procedure. The structure contains the return value from the window procedure that processed the message, as well as the message parameters associated with the message. Subclassing the window does not work for messages set between processes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_CBT
member.summary: The system calls a WH_CBT hook procedure before activating, creating, destroying, minimizing, maximizing, moving, or sizing a window; before completing a system command; before removing a mouse or keyboard event from the system message queue; before setting the input focus; or before synchronizing with the system message queue. The value the hook procedure returns determines whether the system allows or prevents one of these operations. The WH_CBT hook is intended primarily for computer-based training (CBT) applications.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_DEBUG
member.summary: The system calls a WH_DEBUG hook procedure before calling hook procedures associated with any other hook in the system. You can use this hook to determine whether to allow the system to call hook procedures associated with other types of hooks.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_FOREGROUNDIDLE
member.summary: The WH_FOREGROUNDIDLE hook enables you to perform low priority tasks during times when its foreground thread is idle. The system calls a WH_FOREGROUNDIDLE hook procedure when the application's foreground thread is about to become idle.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_GETMESSAGE
member.summary: The WH_GETMESSAGE hook enables an application to monitor messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the WH_GETMESSAGE hook to monitor mouse and keyboard input and other messages posted to the message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_HARDWARE
member.summary: The WH_HARDWARE hook enables you to monitor various hardware events.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK
member.summary: The WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook enables an application to insert messages into the system message queue. You can use this hook to play back a series of mouse and keyboard events recorded earlier by using WH_JOURNALRECORD. Regular mouse and keyboard input is disabled as long as a WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook is installed. A WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook is a global hookit cannot be used as a thread-specific hook. The WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK hook returns a time-out value. This value tells the system how many milliseconds to wait before processing the current message from the playback hook. This enables the hook to control the timing of the events it plays back.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_JOURNALRECORD
member.summary: The WH_JOURNALRECORD hook enables you to monitor and record input events. Typically, you use this hook to record a sequence of mouse and keyboard events to play back later by using WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK. The WH_JOURNALRECORD hook is a global hookit cannot be used as a thread-specific hook.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_KEYBOARD
member.summary: The WH_KEYBOARD hook enables an application to monitor message traffic for WM_KEYDOWN and WM_KEYUP messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the WH_KEYBOARD hook to monitor keyboard input posted to a message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_KEYBOARD_LL
member.summary: The WH_KEYBOARD_LL hook enables you to monitor keyboard input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_MOUSE
member.summary: The WH_MOUSE hook enables you to monitor mouse messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the WH_MOUSE hook to monitor mouse input posted to a message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_MOUSE_LL
member.summary: The WH_MOUSE_LL hook enables you to monitor mouse input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_MSGFILTER
member.summary: The WH_MSGFILTER and WH_SYSMSGFILTER hooks enable you to monitor messages about to be processed by a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box, and to detect when a different window is about to be activated as a result of the user's pressing the ALT+TAB or ALT+ESC key combination. The WH_MSGFILTER hook can only monitor messages passed to a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box created by the application that installed the hook procedure. The WH_SYSMSGFILTER hook monitors such messages for all applications.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_SHELL
member.summary: A shell application can use the WH_SHELL hook to receive important notifications. The system calls a WH_SHELL hook procedure when the shell application is about to be activated and when a top-level window is created or destroyed. Note that custom shell applications do not receive WH_SHELL messages. Therefore, any application that registers itself as the default shell must call the SystemParametersInfo function before it (or any other application) can receive WH_SHELL messages. This function must be called with SPI_SETMINIMIZEDMETRICS and a MINIMIZEDMETRICS structure. Set the iArrange member of this structure to ARW_HIDE.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFunc.WH_SYSMSGFILTER
member.summary: The WH_MSGFILTER and WH_SYSMSGFILTER hooks enable you to monitor messages about to be processed by a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box, and to detect when a different window is about to be activated as a result of the user's pressing the ALT+TAB or ALT+ESC key combination. The WH_MSGFILTER hook can only monitor messages passed to a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box created by the application that installed the hook procedure. The WH_SYSMSGFILTER hook monitors such messages for all applications. The WH_MSGFILTER and WH_SYSMSGFILTER hooks enable you to perform message filtering during modal loops that is equivalent to the filtering done in the main message loop. For example, an application often examines a new message in the main loop between the time it retrieves the message from the queue and the time it dispatches the message, performing special processing as appropriate. However, during a modal loop, the system retrieves and dispatches messages without allowing an application the chance to filter the messages in its main message loop. If an application installs a WH_MSGFILTER or WH_SYSMSGFILTER hook procedure, the system calls the procedure during the modal loop.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated attribute values of window's statements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.DWL_DLGPROC
member.summary: Retrieves the address of the dialog box procedure, or a handle representing the address of the dialog box procedure. You must use the CallWindowProc function to call the dialog box procedure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.DWL_MSGRESULT
member.summary: Retrieves the return value of a message processed in the dialog box procedure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.DWL_USER
member.summary: Retrieves extra information private to the application, such as handles or pointers.

member.summary: Sets a new application instance handle.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.GWL_ID
member.summary: Sets a new identifier of the child window. The window cannot be a top-level window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.GWL_STYLE
member.summary: Sets a new window style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.GWL_USERDATA
member.summary: Sets the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFunc.GWL_WNDPROC
member.summary: Sets a new address for the window procedure. You cannot change this attribute if the window does not belong to the same process as the calling thread.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of system command requests.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_CLOSE
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_HOTKEY
member.summary: Activates the window associated with the application-specified hot key. The lParam parameter identifies the window to activate.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_HSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls horizontally.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_KEYMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_MONITORPOWER
member.summary: Sets the state of the display. This command supports devices that have power-saving features, such as a battery-powered personal computer. - The lParam parameter can have the following values: -1 (the display is powering on), 1 (the display is going to low power), 2 (the display is being shut off).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_MOUSEMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a mouse click.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_MOVE
member.summary: Moves the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_NEXTWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the next window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_PREVWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the previous window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_RESTORE
member.summary: Restores the window to its normal position and size.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_SCREENSAVE
member.summary: Executes the screen saver application specified in the [boot] section of the System.ini file.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_SIZE
member.summary: Sizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_TASKLIST
member.summary: Activates the Start menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SC_VSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls vertically.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.SCF_ISSECURE
member.summary: Indicates whether the screen saver is secure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.WM_COPYDATA
member.summary: If the receiving application processes this message, it should return TRUE; otherwise, it should return FALSE. The data being passed must not contain pointers or other references to objects not accessible to the application receiving the data. While this message is being sent, the referenced data must not be changed by another thread of the sending process. The receiving application should consider the data read-only. The lParam parameter is valid only during the processing of the message. The receiving application should not free the memory referenced by lParam. If the receiving application must access the data after SendMessage returns, it must copy the data into a local buffer.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.WM_INITDIALOG
member.summary: The dialog box procedure should return TRUE to direct the system to set the keyboard focus to the control specified by wParam. Otherwise, it should return FALSE to prevent the system from setting the default keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.WM_SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFunc.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacement
member.summary: Provides enumerated flags of window placements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacement.WPF_ASYNCWINDOWPLACEMENT
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacement.WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED
member.summary:
The restored window will be maximized, regardless of whether it was maximized before it was minimized. This setting is only valid the next time the window is restored. It does not change the default restoration behavior.
This flag is only valid when the value is specified for the showCmd member.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacement.WPF_SETMINPOSITION
member.summary:
The coordinates of the minimized window may be specified.
This flag must be specified if the coordinates are set in the ptMinPosition member.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the style).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_ICONIC
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the style. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the style. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The and styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_SIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_TILED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: The window accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. cannot be used with the or styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: The window has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: The window is a layered window. This style cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_NOREDIRECTIONBITMAP
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: The window is palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: The window should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFunc.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS
member.summary: Contains status information for a service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwCheckPoint
member.summary: The check-point value the service increments periodically to report its progress during a lengthy start, stop, pause, or continue operation. For example, the service should increment this value as it completes each step of its initialization when it is starting up. The user interface program that invoked the operation on the service uses this value to track the progress of the service during a lengthy operation. This value is not valid and should be zero when the service does not have a start, stop, pause, or continue operation pending.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwControlsAccepted
member.summary: The control codes the service accepts and processes in its handler function (see Handler and HandlerEx). A user interface process can control a service by specifying a control command in the ControlService or ControlServiceEx function. By default, all services accept the value. To accept the SERVICE_CONTROL_DEVICEEVENT value, the service must register to receive device events by using the RegisterDeviceNotification function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwCurrentState
member.summary: The current state of the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwServiceSpecificExitCode
member.summary: A service-specific error code that the service returns when an error occurs while the service is starting or stopping. This value is ignored unless the dwWin32ExitCode member is set to ERROR_SERVICE_SPECIFIC_ERROR.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwServiceType
member.summary: The type of service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwWaitHint
member.summary: The estimated time required for a pending start, stop, pause, or continue operation, in milliseconds. Before the specified amount of time has elapsed, the service should make its next call to the SetServiceStatus function with either an incremented dwCheckPoint value or a change in dwCurrentState. If the amount of time specified by dwWaitHint passes, and dwCheckPoint has not been incremented or dwCurrentState has not changed, the service control manager or service control program can assume that an error has occurred and the service should be stopped. However, if the service shares a process with other services, the service control manager cannot terminate the service application because it would have to terminate the other services sharing the process as well.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SERVICE_STATUS.dwWin32ExitCode
member.summary: The error code the service uses to report an error that occurs when it is starting or stopping. To return an error code specific to the service, the service must set this value to ERROR_SERVICE_SPECIFIC_ERROR to indicate that the dwServiceSpecificExitCode member contains the error code. The service should set this value to NO_ERROR when it is running and on normal termination.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.SafeNativeMethods
member.summary:
Represents safe native methods.
This class suppresses stack walks for unmanaged code permission. ( is applied to this class.) This class is for methods that are safe for anyone to call. Callers of these methods are not required to perform a full security review to make sure that the usage is secure because the methods are harmless for any caller.

member.name: M:SilDev.WinApi.SafeNativeMethods.AllocConsole
member.summary: Allocates a new console for the calling process.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:SilDev.WinApi.SafeNativeMethods.GetAsyncKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether a key is up or down at the time the function is called, and whether the key was pressed after a previous call to .
member.param: The virtual-key code.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value specifies whether the key was pressed since the last call to , and whether the key is currently up or down. If the most significant bit is set, the key is down, and if the least significant bit is set, the key was pressed after the previous call to .
The return value is zero if the current desktop is not the active desktop, or if the foreground thread belongs to another process and the desktop does not allow the hook or the journal record.

member.name: M:SilDev.WinApi.SafeNativeMethods.GetConsoleWindow
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle used by the console associated with the calling process.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the window used by the console associated with the calling process or NULL if there is no such associated console.

member.name: M:SilDev.WinApi.SafeNativeMethods.DwmGetColorizationParameters(SilDev.WinApi.DWM_COLORIZATION_PARAMS@)
